Posts.Content: tjohnson1971 wrote: I had a stereotactic biopsy on 8-10, was told 2 days later is was ALH.  So they want to remove the lump on 9-29.  I keep thinking since I have had nipple pain for some months, not thinking it meant anything but maybe I was sleeping on it, that my diagnosis will change when they remove the rest.  Did anyone have nipple pain/tenderness before they were diagnosed?   Did your diagnosis change after the surgery or was it still the same stuff, ALH?    How many times do lumps show up ALH and then turn into something more?  I know I have read it raises risk 5%.    Dx 10/2011, LCIS, Right Dx 3/22/2019, ILC, Right, <1cm, ER+/PR+, HER2- (IHC) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Anyone w/ ALH on biopsy get different results after surgery? tjohnson1971 funsizejen

Posts.Content: tjohnson1971 wrote: I have been just not myself since this all came about.  It doesn't help that the kids are back at school, so I am alone with my thoughts and the internet all day.  I normally don't get grumpy at my husband and have been not very nice.  I feel like I can't talk to anyone about how I am feeling because I am scared of the "unknown" and people who are not going through this, just don't get it.  I called my mom and told her I just needed a pep talk, and she texted me back, "Worry is like a rocking horse, it gets you no where."  Ok, I know that.  But that still doesn't help the way I feel.  Thanks mom for the effort.  Anyway, how did this effect you? Dx 10/2011, LCIS, Right Dx 3/22/2019, ILC, Right, <1cm, ER+/PR+, HER2- (IHC) Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: Did any of you get crabby or depressed before lumpectomy? tjohnson1971 Natters

Posts.Content: tjohnson1971 wrote: Ok, I know my excisional biopsy is tomorrow and why I just noticed this today only, makes me think I'm just anxoious about tomorrow.   When I got dress this morning, I was bending forward and could see the lump, I never noticed this before.  Also, it could be the scar tissue from the stereotactic biopsy, but it took me by surprise that I could see it not just feel it.  Did any of you have a scar tissue lump after the 1st biopsy, mine was 2 months ago?  It doesn't really matter I guess, because they are taking it all out anyway tomorrow.  Just curious.  Dx 10/2011, LCIS, Right Dx 3/22/2019, ILC, Right, <1cm, ER+/PR+, HER2- (IHC) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: b4 excisional biop, did you see your lump? tjohnson1971 tjohnson1971

Posts.Content: tjohnson1971 wrote: I had my excisional biopsy/lumpectomy 2 wks ago.  It is sore but not to where I need medication.  I have swollen hard areas, which feel like rocks.  Is this normal?  How long does it take for the swelling to go down.  What about itching?  And numbness, it's numb all around the excision, and itchy beyond that.  Also, if I squeeze, there is a tiny bit of blood that still comes out of nipple.  I know, don't squeeze it right?  Also noticing a sort of linear dent not where scar is but adjacent to it.  Any of this sound familiar?  If you could share or remember how you felt afterwards and how long it took for hard lumpy feeling to go away. please let me know. I appreciate it.  I just want to feel normal again. Dx 10/2011, LCIS, Right Dx 3/22/2019, ILC, Right, <1cm, ER+/PR+, HER2- (IHC) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: ? for Lumpectomy--afterwards tjohnson1971 tjohnson1971
